meanings.definition: To make a fetish of something.
meanings.sent1: She would fetishise her lucky charm before every exam.
meanings.sent2: Some people fetishise certain objects for good luck.
meanings.sent3: He would jokingly fetishise his favorite pen by always carrying it around.
meanings.sent4: Her tendency to fetishise her phone turned it into an extension of herself.
meanings.sent5: The way he fetishised his old guitar made it seem like a magical instrument.

meanings.definition: To treat something with excessive reverence or devotion.
meanings.sent1: The fans would fetishise the rock star's every move.
meanings.sent2: Some cultures fetishise certain traditions to preserve their heritage.
meanings.sent3: She would playfully fetishise her morning coffee by calling it her 'liquid gold'.
meanings.sent4: His friends often teased him for fetishising his favorite sports team.
meanings.sent5: The artist would fetishise every brushstroke in her masterpiece, treating it like a precious gem.
